frameDefinitions: A State_of_affairs is generally, or with regard to a particular Feature, representative of its class, which may be narrowed to a specific Comparison_set.
In the course of history, an Event or Entity is taken to have importance or significance.
A Phenomenon is portrayed with respect to the Degree of likelihood that it will  be perceived and known, given the (usually implicit)
A Feature of an Entity serves to distinguish the Entity from other members of its type which have a different value for the Feature.
A linguistic Form has a particular Meaning, possibly restricted to a particular Context.
An Entity stands out perceptually in comparison to other members of its type.
frameExamples: The Elan truly is an <t>unusual</t> car; the first and only Lotus with a front engined/front wheel drive layout, and the first new Lotus to be introduced since 1975.
Throughout the campaign activists have <t>made</t> financial <t>history</t> as one by one major corporations have yielded to protester power
It's abundantly <t>obvious</t> that we'll need to spend more time on public perception.
His <t>distinctive</t> flowing gait and skill with the rapier set him apart from his fellows.
'Unicorn' <t>denotes</t> a mythological horse with a horn on its head.
Pilot Mountain in NC is very <t>prominent</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: The state of affairs which is evaluated with regard to whether it exhibits the essential characteristics of a Comparison_set.
A property of the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> wherein it differs or is similar to members of a <fen>Comparison_set</fen>.
This role identifies the event which occurs to create history.
This role identifies the entity, concrete or abstract.
This role identifies the time when the event occurs.
This role identifies where the event takes place.
The entity or facts that are undeniable given the <fen>Evidence</fen>.
The gradable aspect of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> which concerns how likely it is that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> be known. This frame element is incorporated by the lexical units in this frame.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> from the norm or from the value for another <fen>Phenomenon</fen> in terms of how likely the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> would be known.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is obvious
The aspect of the <fen>Entity</fen> which makes it different from the other members of its class.
The item which differs from other members of its class in the <fen>Feature</fen>'s value.
<fen>Form</fen> is the formal pole of a linguistic sign.
<fen>Meaning</fen> is the sense of a linguistic <fen>Form</fen>.
<fen>Referent</fen> identifies an object in the real (or a hypothetical) world that a linguistic expression is used to talk about.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the saliency <fen>Attribute</fen> is appropriate and under consideration.
The feature of the <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion, namely perceptual salience.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular salience.
This role refers to the location where the <fen>Entity</fen> has a prominence of some <fen>Attribute</fen>.
listRoleExamples: However I have always loved having an unusual <fex>name</fex> and I think it's a beautiful name. .
David Hasselhoff's daughters are normal <fex>in every way</fex>.
It is obvious for example <fex>that 9/10 is not the same as 1</fex>.
It is <fex>abundantly</fex> obvious you have not a clue how the Retro Program works.
It is obvious <fex>now</fex> that Senator O. T. Tawa has no plan.
That never depleting ammo in his arsenal - his signature <fex>smile</fex> - is contagious.
These signatures may be distinctive <fex>of the entire Chlamydiales order</fex>.
If you are asked to search for the plus sign with red-vertical and green-horizontal elements, <fex>all the red and green plus signs</fex> may seem to become salient.
The diagram, (a frequency distribution chart) shows a <fex>prominently</fex> conspicuous region of stars that extend from the extremely bright and hot stars to the faint and cool variety.
The affection for American culture seemed more prominent <fex>last year</fex>.
